statements.name: PROC S3
statements.description: Specifies the connection parameters for connecting to Amazon S3.
statements.help:
PROC S3 
                        <AWSCONFIG="AWS-CLI-file-path">
                        <CONFIG="local-configuration-file-path">
                        <PROFILE="configuration-profile-name">
                        <AWSCREDENTIALS="AWS-credentials-file-path">
                        <CREDENTIALSPROFILE="credentials-profile-name">
                        <AUTHDOMAIN="AWS-authentication-domain">
                        <ROLENAME="IAM-role-name" | ROLEARN="IAM-role-ARN">
                        <KEYID="AWS-key-ID">
                        <SECRET="AWS-secret">
                        <SESSION="session-token">
                        <SSL | NOSSL>
                        <REGION=AWS-region>;
	BUCKET 
                              "bucket-name"
                              ACCELERATE | NOACCELERATE;
                        
	COPY 
                              <SRCKEY="key-name">
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              <ACL="canned-ACL-value">
                              "source-s3-location"
                              "destination-s3-location";
                        
	CREATE 
                              "bucket-name";
                        
	DELETE 
                              "s3-location";
                        
	DESTROY 
                              "bucket-name";
                        
	ENCKEY 
                              ADD | REPLACE
                              NAME="key-name"
                              ID="key-ID"
                              
		<CONTEXT="key-context">;
                        
	GET 
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              "s3-location"
                              "local-file-path";
                        
	GETACCEL 
                              "bucket-name";
                        
	GETDIR 
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              "s3-location"
                              "local-path";
                        
	INFO 
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              "s3-location";
                        
	LIST 
                              <_SHORT_>
                              "s3-location"
                              <OUT=libref.file>;
                        
	MKDIR 
                              <ACL="canned-ACL-value">
                              "s3-location";
                        
	PUT 
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              <ACL="canned-ACL-value">
                              "local-path"
                              "s3-location";
                        
	PUTDIR 
                              <ENCKEY="key-name">
                              <ACL="canned-ACL-value">
                              "local-path"
                              "s3-location";
                        
	REGION 
                              ADD
                              HOST="AWS-server"
                              NAME="region-name"
                              <PORT=port-value>
                              <SSLPORT=SSL-port>
                              <SSLALLOWED>
                              <SSLREQUIRED>
                              <REPLACE>;
                        
	RMDIR 
                              "s3-location";
                  RUN;

arguments.name: AUTHDOMAIN=
arguments.description: specifies an authentication domain to use when you connect to AWS. An authentication domain is typically defined by your administrator. For more information, see .

arguments.name: AWSCONFIG=
arguments.description: specifies the path of the AWS CLI configuration file, called config. This file contains connection parameters to access Amazon S3. If a value is specified in the AWS CLI configuration file and in the PROC S3 configuration file, the value in the AWS CLI file takes precedence.

arguments.name: AWSCREDENTIALS=
arguments.description: specifies the path of the AWS credentials file. This file contains the credentials that are used to access Amazon S3.

arguments.name: CONFIG=
arguments.description: specifies the path and file name of the PROC S3 configuration file that contains connection parameters to access Amazon S3. If you specify this option, then the specified configuration file is read instead of the default PROC S3 configuration file in the default location.

arguments.name: CREDENTIALSPROFILE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the profile that contains the credentials that you want to use to access Amazon S3. Sets of credential options are grouped into profiles. If you do not specify the CREDENTIALSPROFILE= option, PROC S3 uses the default profile.

arguments.name: KEYID=
arguments.description: specifies the AWS access key ID. This value is a 20-character, alphanumeric string. A sample key ID value is AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE.

arguments.name: PROFILE=
arguments.description: specifies the profile to use in the AWS CLI file config. Sets of options are grouped into profiles. If you do not specify the PROFILE= option, PROC S3 uses the default profile.

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: specifies the AWS region to connect to. Here are the predefined region values.

arguments.name: ROLEARN=
arguments.description: specifies an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies an IAM role. The associated IAM role enables you to get access credentials to S3 via the AssumeRole IAM operation.

arguments.name: ROLENAME=
arguments.description: specifies an IAM role name that enables you to get access credentials to S3 via the AssumeRole IAM operation.

arguments.name: SECRET=
arguments.description: specifies the AWS secret access key. This value is a 40-character string. A sample secret access value is wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY.

arguments.name: SESSION=
arguments.description: specifies the AWS session token. Use this value if you are using temporary AWS security credentials.

arguments.name: SSL
arguments.description: SSL specifies that SSL or TLS should be enabled during data transfer. NOSSL specifies that SSL or TLS should be disabled during data transfer.

arguments.name: NOSSL
arguments.description: SSL specifies that SSL or TLS should be enabled during data transfer. NOSSL specifies that SSL or TLS should be disabled during data transfer.

statements.name: BUCKET
statements.description: Sets the acceleration transfer mode for the specified bucket.

arguments.name: bucket-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the S3 bucket for which you are setting transfer acceleration mode. For more information, see .

arguments.name: ACCELERATE
arguments.description: enables transfer acceleration for the specified bucket.

arguments.name: NOACCELERATE
arguments.description: disables transfer acceleration for the specified bucket.

statements.name: COPY
statements.description: Copies an object from an S3 source location to an S3 destination.

arguments.name: source-s3-location
arguments.description: specifies the S3 location of the object to be copied. Fully qualify the S3 location from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: destination-s3-location
arguments.description: specifies the S3 location to which an object should be copied. Fully qualify the S3 location from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: ACL=
arguments.description: specifies a canned ACL value that applies to a newly created object in the destination location.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name that identifies the encryption for the created object. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

arguments.name: SRCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption of the source object. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

arguments.name: bucket-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of the S3 bucket that you are creating. The name of the S3 bucket that you create must be unique across S3.

statements.name: DELETE
statements.description: Deletes an S3 location or object.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies the S3 location that you are deleting. Fully qualify the S3 location from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: bucket-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of an S3 bucket that you are deleting. The bucket that you specify must exist in S3 and must be empty.

statements.name: ENCKEY
statements.description: Specifies the encryption key for an S3 location.
statements.help:
Form 1: 
ENCKEY 
                                    ADD | REPLACE
                                    NAME="key-name"
                                    ID="key-ID"
                                    <CONTEXT="key-context">;
Form 2: 
ENCKEY 
                                    ADD | REPLACE
                                    NAME="key-name"
                                    KEY="key-string"
                                    <ALGORITHM="S3-encryption-algorithm">
                                    <CONTEXT="key-context">;
Form 3: 
ENCKEY 
                                    ADD | REPLACE
                                    NAME="key-name"
                                    HEXKEY="hexadecimal-value"
                                    <ALGORITHM="S3-encryption-algorithm">
                                    <CONTEXT="key-context">;
Form 4: 
ENCKEY 
                                    LIST
                                    <NAME="key-name">;
Form 5: 
ENCKEY 
                                    REMOVE
                                    NAME="key-name";

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: indicates that you are adding an encryption key.

arguments.name: ALGORITHM=
arguments.description: specifies the S3 encryption algorithm that is used in the S3 location.

arguments.name: CONTEXT=
arguments.description: specifies the key context for the encryption key.

arguments.name: HEXKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key in the form of a 64-digit hexadecimal value.

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: specifies the key ID for the encryption key.

arguments.name: KEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key as a 32-byte character string.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: requests a list of defined encryption keys.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the encryption key name. This is a user-friendly name that you can use to refer to an encryption key. The value is case insensitive.

arguments.name: REMOVE
arguments.description: removes an encryption key from the list of defined keys.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: specifies that the existing encryption key should be replaced. If not set, any attempt to redefine an encryption key fails.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies the name of an S3 object to retrieve. Fully qualify the location from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: local-file-path
arguments.description: specifies a local file in which to store the object. For example, you might set this value to /u/$USER/myfile.txt.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name that identifies the encryption to use during data retrieval. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement. The name must also correspond to the encryption key that was used when the object was created in the S3 environment. Otherwise, S3 returns an error.

statements.name: GETACCEL
statements.description: Retrieves the transfer acceleration status for a bucket.

arguments.name: bucket-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of an S3 bucket for which you want the transfer acceleration status. For more information, see .

statements.name: GETDIR
statements.description: Retrieves the contents of an S3 directory.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies the name of an S3 directory to retrieve. Fully qualify the location from the bucket name to the directory.

arguments.name: local-path
arguments.description: specifies a directory that is local to the SAS client. For example, you might set this value to /u/$USER/.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name that identifies the encryption to use during data retrieval. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

statements.name: INFO
statements.description: Requests information in the SAS log about an S3 location.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a fully qualified path from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

statements.name: LIST
statements.description: Requests information in the SAS log about the contents of an S3 location.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a fully qualified path from the bucket name to the object name. The object that you specify is typically a container, such as a bucket or a directory.

arguments.name: _SHORT_
arguments.description: specifies that you want a list of object names only.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies an output file for the output of the LIST statement.

statements.name: MKDIR
statements.description: Specifies a directory to create in an S3 location.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a fully qualified path from the bucket name to the directory name that you want to create.

arguments.name: ACL=
arguments.description: specifies a canned ACL value that applies to newly created objects in the specified directory.

statements.name: PUT
statements.description: Specifies a local object to write to an S3 location.

arguments.name: local-path
arguments.description: specifies a file or directory that is local to the SAS client.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a location in S3. Fully qualify the path from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: ACL=
arguments.description: specifies a canned ACL value that applies to a new object in the specified S3 location.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name that identifies the encryption to use when storing data in S3. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

statements.name: PUTDIR
statements.description: Specifies a local directory to write to an S3 location.

arguments.name: local-path
arguments.description: specifies a directory that is local to the SAS client.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a location in S3. Fully qualify the path from the bucket name to the object name.

arguments.name: ACL=
arguments.description: specifies a canned ACL value that applies to an object in the specified S3 location.

arguments.name: ENCKEY=
arguments.description: specifies an encryption key name that identifies the encryption to use when writing to S3. The name must match an encryption key name that you specified in an ENCKEY statement.

statements.name: REGION
statements.description: Enables you to add, list, or remove custom regions.
statements.help:
Form 1: 
REGION 
                                    ADD
                                    HOST="AWS-server"
                                    <REGION="AWS-region-value">
                                    NAME="region-name"
                                    <PORT=port-value>
                                    <SSLPORT=SSL-port>
                                    <SSLALLOWED>
                                    <SSLREQUIRED>
                                    <REPLACE>;
Form 2: 
REGION 
                                    LIST;
Form 3: 
REGION 
                                    REMOVE
                                    NAME="region-name";

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: specifies that you are adding a custom region for the S3 environment.

arguments.name: HOST=
arguments.description: specifies the server that PROC S3 connects to on AWS.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies a unique name for the region that you are adding or removing.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: requests a list of all defined S3 regions.

arguments.name: REMOVE
arguments.description: specifies to remove the region that you identify with the NAME= option.

arguments.name: PORT=
arguments.description: specifies the HTTP port value to use to connect to S3 without SSL.

arguments.name: REGION=
arguments.description: specifies the region code for the region that you are adding or replacing.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: indicates that a custom region should be added and should overwrite a region of the same name, if it exists.

arguments.name: SSLALLOWED
arguments.description: indicates that SSL is allowed when communicating with the S3 environment.

arguments.name: SSLPORT=
arguments.description: specifies the HTTP port value to use to connect to S3 with SSL.

arguments.name: SSLREQUIRED
arguments.description: indicates that all communications with the S3 environment must be made using SSL.

statements.name: RMDIR
statements.description: Specifies a directory to delete from an S3 location.

arguments.name: s3-location
arguments.description: specifies a directory in S3. Fully qualify the path from the bucket name to the directory name. The directory that you specify must be empty.
